metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10001 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An input validation issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Thisissue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.1, Security Update 2020-001 Catalina,Security Update 2020-007 Mojave. A malicious application may be able toread restricted memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.9').
